sen.j: 日華門（にっかもん・じっかもん）は、内裏を構成する内閤門のうちの一つで、紫宸殿南庭（なんてい・だんてい）の東側の門である。
sen.e: Nikka-mon (or jikka mon) Gate was one of the naikaku-mon gates in dairi (Imperial Palace) and is placed on the east side of the south garden of Shishin-den Hall (hall for state ceremonies).
Nikka-mon (or jikka mon) Gate was one of the naikaku-mon gates that comprised the dairi (Imperial Palace) and was located on the east side of the south garden of the Shishinden Hall (Throne Hall).
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように再翻訳
sen.e: Nikka-mon (or jikka mon) Gate was one of the naikaku-mon gates that comprised the dairi (Imperial Palace) and was located on the east side of the south garden of the Shishinden Hall (Throne Hall).

sen.j: 現在の京都御所にも古式に則って再建されたものが伝わっている。
sen.e: Even in the present Kyoto Imperial Palace, Nikkamon Gate is restored based on traditional rules.
The Nikka-mon Gate that stands in the present Kyoto Imperial Palace was rebuilt according to the ancient design.
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように再翻訳
sen.e: The Nikka-mon Gate that stands in the present Kyoto Imperial Palace was rebuilt according to the ancient design.

sen.j: 宜陽殿と春興殿との間にあり、南庭西側の月華門とは東西に相対する。
sen.e: Located between Giyo-den (storeroom) Hall and Shunkyo-den Hall, this gate faced Gekka-mon Gate placed on the west side of the south garden.
Located between Giyoden Hall (Treasure Hall) and Shunkyoden Hall, the gate faced Gekka-mon Gate on the west side of the south garden.
sen.cmt: ・「the」を２つ補足・「Giyo-den」→「Giyoden」・「Hall」を２つ削除・「Shunkyo-den」→「Shunkyoden」・「placed」を削除・「this」→「the]
sen.e: Located between Giyoden Hall (Treasure Hall) and Shunkyoden Hall, the gate faced Gekka-mon Gate on the west side of the south garden in an east-west direction.
sen.cmt: 「東西に」の意を追加しました。

sen.j: 東の中門ともいい、近衛府の陣に充てられたため、左近陣（さこんのじん）ともいう。
sen.e: It was also called Chu-mon Gate in the east, and was called Sakonno-jin (jin: a troop station) as well, because the troop station of Konoefu (Inner Palace guards) was placed there.

It was also called "Higashi no Chu-mon" (lit. eastern inner gate) and "Sakonfu no Jin" (lit. Post of the Inner Palace Guards) because it was assigned to serve as a post for the Konoefu (Inner Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように再翻訳
sen.e: It was also called "Higashi no Chu-mon" (lit. eastern inner gate) and "Sakonfu no Jin" (lit. Post of the Inner Palace Guards) because it was assigned to serve as a post for the Konoefu (Inner Palace Guards).

sen.j: 摂関期には摂関を座長とする朝議（陣定）が、紫宸殿から宜陽殿に続く軒廊（こんろう）にある左近衛陣座で盛んに行われた。
sen.e: In the Sekkan (regent and a top-adviser to Emperor) period, chogi (ceremony at Imperial Court) (Jin no sadame (ancient cabinet council)) was held frequently, with Sekkan as the chairman, in Sakonoe-jinnoza (the headquarters of the left division of Inner Palace guards) placed in Konro (a roofed corridor with open sides) between Shishin-den Hall and Giyo-den Hall.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During the Sekkan period (period of regents and advisors), the Court Council (Jin no Sadame; ancient cabinet council) chaired by regents and advisors was frequently held in the Sakone (Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) court in the roofed corridor that led from the Shishinden Hall to the Giyoden Hall.

During the Sekkan period (period of regents and advisors), the Court Council (Jin no Sadame; ancient cabinet council) chaired by regents and advisors was frequently held in the Sakone (Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) court in the roofed corridor that led from the Shishinden Hall to the Giyoden Hall.

sen.j: その故、日華門は左近衛陣座に近いため、月華門よりも重要とされた。
sen.e: With Nikka-mon Gate placed nearer to Sakonoe-jinnoza, it is said that this gate was considered more important than Gekka-mon Gate.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Because of this, Nikka-mon gate was considered to be more important that Gekka-mon gate due to its close proximity to the Sakone court.
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように再翻訳
sen.e: Because of this, Nikka-mon gate was considered to be more important than Gekka-mon gate due to its close proximity to the Sakone court.
